metadata.title: CVE-2024-37370 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.21.3, an attacker can modify theplaintext Extra Count field of a confidential GSS krb5 wrap token, causingthe unwrapped token to appear truncated to the application.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-37370` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
krb5-gss-samples - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
krb5-k5tls - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
krb5-kdc - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
krb5-locales - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
krb5-multidev - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
krb5-otp - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
krb5-pkinit - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
krb5-user - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
libgssrpc4 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
libk5crypto3 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
libkadm5clnt-mit9 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
libkadm5srv-mit9 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
libkdb5-8 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
libkrad0 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
libkrb5-3 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
libkrb5support0 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: krb5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.2+esm5').
